greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Table c(n,k) of the numerators of coefficients [x^k] P(n,x) of the polynomials P(n,x) of A129891.
comment: The polynomials P(n,x) are defined in A129891: P(0,x)=1 and
reference: P. Curtz Gazette des Mathematiciens, 1992, 52, p. 44.
P. Curtz Integration Numerique .. Note 12 du Centre de Calcul Scientifique de l'Armement, Arcueil, 1969. Now in 35170, Bruz.
P. Flajolet, X. Gourdon, B. Salvy id, 1993, 55, pp. 67-78.
link: Jean-François Alcover, Plot showing roots of P(200,x) in shape of a cardioid
example: The coefficients and polynomials for n =0,1,2, ... are
maple: P := proc(n,x) option remember ; if n =0 then 1; else (-1)^n/(n+1)+x*add( (-1)^i/(i+1)*procname(n-1-i,x),i=0..n-1) ; expand(%) ; fi; end:
A140749 := proc(n,k) p := P(n,x) ; numer(coeftayl(p,x=0,k)) ; end: seq(seq(A140749(n, k),k=0..n),n=0..13) ; # _R. J. Mathar_, Aug 24 2009
mathematica: Numerator[ Flatten[ Table[ CoefficientList[p[n], x], {n, 0, 11}]]][[1 ;; 69]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 17 2011 *)
results.author: _Paul Curtz_, Jul 13 2008
ext: Edited and extended by _R. J. Mathar_, Aug 24 2009
